class.name: com.rawabi.model.AccessNumber
class.comment: Telephone Number used to access the system.

column.name: SERVICE_PROVIDER_ID
column.comment: Service Provider OID

column.name: ACCESS_NUMBER
column.comment: Telephone Number used to access the system. (e.g. 1-800-XXX-XXXX)

column.name: DIALING_PLAN_ID
column.comment: The dialing plan associated with the access number. Used for

column.name: STATUS
column.comment: status of access_number - Active (0) Inactive (1)

column.name: DOM_INTL_FLAG
column.comment: Is the access number a domestic or international originating access number. Used for determining whether to rate A leg as international or domestic. I=International, D=Domestic, U=Unspecified. 'U' will trigger rating to use ANI for international origination detection. See admin guide for full details.

column.name: ACD_ENABLED
column.comment: Is ACD Enabled for this access number 'T'=true, 'F'=false

column.name: ACD_CSR_GREET
column.comment: For ACD. When a caller calls into this access number, if 'T'automatically route them to a CSR to collect their pin or passcode.

column.name: ACD_CSR_ON_MAX_LOGINS
column.comment: For ACD. If a participant exceeds the maximum number of login attempts, route the caller to a CSR

column.name: THIRD_PARTY_ACD_AVAILABLE
column.comment: Is third party service available

column.name: APPLY_PAYPHONE_SURCHARGES
column.comment: T/F flag indicating whether or not payphone surcharges will be applied for calls to this access number. If F, payphone surcharges will be excluded. If T and call originates from a payphone, payphone surcharge rates will apply.

column.name: PAYPHONE_SWIPE_FLAG
column.comment: T/F flag indicating that the access number is used for payphone swipe access. This triggers a different callflow.

column.name: CALLBACK_FLAG
column.comment: Indicates whether this access number is provisioned such that callers calling into it will be dialed back by the system instead of answering the INVITE.

column.name: APPLICATION_TYPE
column.comment: Use to determine prepaid vs postpaid for combined callflow applications 0 = n/a 1 = prepaid 3 = postpaid 8=prepaid/postpaid.

column.name: COLLECT_PIN_FLAG
column.comment: For unauthorized ANI, collect pin from subscriber

column.name: IVR_CHARGE_NC_CALLS_FLAG
column.comment: Charge subscriber for time spent on IVR for non-completed calls.

column.name: DIRECT_CALL_FLAG
column.comment: Indicates whether the access number is a direct call access number where the caller is prompted for a direct call ID.

column.name: MAIN_MENU_FLAG
column.comment: T - allow IVR main menu access. F - do not allow.

column.name: TOLL_NUMBER_FLAG
column.comment: Flag that specifies whether this is a toll free number (T) or a local access number (F).

column.name: EVENT_FLAG
column.comment: Specifies whether this access number identifies event conferences.

column.name: PREPAID_PIN_LENGTH
column.comment: number of digits to collect for prepaid PIN from IVR

column.name: THIRD_PARTY_OUTDIAL_DURATION
column.comment: Minutes before hang up

column.name: LANGUAGE_MENU_ID
column.comment: Nullable column identifying the optional language menu to play when a caller calls this access number.

column.name: DIALED_NUMBER
column.comment: Holds the actual number dialed by the user, as opposed to the access number which is a network translated number.

column.name: THIRD_PARTY_OUTDIAL_NUMBER
column.comment: Service Number

column.name: PREPAID_CARD_NUMBER_LENGTH
column.comment: Number of digits to collect if account type is prepaid.

column.name: POSTPAID_ACCT_NUMBER_LENGTH
column.comment: Number of digits to collect if account type is postpaid.
